phrases: Just like a sickness that continues to progress without any visible symptoms,
there was someone hiding in our town of Morioh,
committing murders somewhere in the town.
And it seems like no one's even realized that these murders are taking place.
It is such shocking and chilling information.
But there is currently no way of finding that murderer.
We do not even know how many Stand users currently live in Morioh.
And rather than worry about a huge problem that presents no visible symptoms,
people are worried about what they should have for dinner,
because that is what is right in front of us.
I only have 285 yen left in my savings!
But I had 20,000 yen in there!
My 20,000 yen that I was saving up to buy those kewl brand-name shoes...
I cannot even remember what I used the money on.
This is all that damn old man's fault!
Because he used my card to buy 130,000 yen worth of baby crap!
I made the old man pay me back the 130,000 later,
but then I felt like spending a little
here and there would not hurt, and totally lost track of my spending.
I wonder if I tucked away a thousand yen somewhere and just forgot about it.
I guess banks could have them, too.
Where the hell is it heading?
I am going to kill it!
There was one at the bank, so I followed it here.
Actually, it did not attack me.
and it suddenly came out from under the vending machine.
But you just said you were going to kill it.
It scared the crap out of me,
and I spilled the Calpis Water all over my uniform.
Hey, another one just joined in...
What the hell are these guys?
There is a ton of them gathering up!
Okuyasu, they are just like your brother Keicho's Stand.
Since they are ignoring us, they are a totally different kind of creepy.
Come to think of it, it picked up a 1 yen coin
underneath a machine at the bank.
They are only 1 yen and 10 yen coins, but they are all real!
Many a little makes a mickle.
I think that is about five thousand yen.
As long as I have you guys, Harvest,
I will never have to worry about money.
He is talking to his Stand...
He seems to have become a Stand user because
of the bow and arrow, but it does not look like he is trying to attack us.
Hey, you can see them, right?!
Yeah, it is called a Stand.
I have never had any before!
I am a second-year at Budogaoka Middle School.
and my Papa and Mama call me Shigechi.
My turtle I have at home is named Gonta.
The other day, I was wondering if the 41 yen, 62 yen,
and 150 yen stamps all tasted different,
so I was licking them all, and Mama yelled at me.
This is a picture of my Mama, who yelled at me.
Wow, your mom's actually kind of hot.
So, you call these things Harvest?
Did they really gather up all this?
From ditches and underneath vending machines and things...
But I am not a thief.
The officer at the police box said that
I did not have to turn in any change under a hundred yen.
That is not a bad thing at all!
Actually, I think you are doing something great for society.
you are putting all of the forgotten change back into the Japanese economy.
Hey, do you think I am a great person?
It is what you would call a blind spot for ideas.
No one would do all this to get money.
D-Did you just call me smart?
N-No one's ever told me that before.
I have picked up about 120,000 yen, but...
B-But that makes me even happier!
Are not I a good boy?
I do not go outside of Morioh.
I might get lost and someone might kidnap me.
Is something wrong with your left foot?
There are three 50 yen coins on the ground!
Do they belong to you, Shigekiyo?
Hey, I will give you guys half of this.
We have the same kind of power.
Look, you should not give other people money or things so easily.
Then I will give it to you in a hard way.
I will give it all to you.
Hey, why are you just hardening your expression?
Let me talk to him alone for a sec, Shigechi.
If he says he is going to give it to us, we should just take it, dumbass!
My pride will not let me do that.
I will take anything anyone wants to give me other than a virus!
I totally understand what you are saying!
I am actually really broke right now, too.
And so I just thought of a nice idea that can make everyone happy.
An idea to make everyone happy?
To All the Good Kids Let us All Play Nice Morioh Town
What you tried to do just now
is the same as trying to buy friendship with money.
B-But that is not what I meant!
something that grows between people through a common bond.
I totally get how you feel.
We are all Stand user buddies.
Why do not we do a little business and strike up a friendship?
A business using all three of our powers.
Basically, I think you are at your limit for picking up lost change.
So I have an idea for how we can use your Harvest
An idea that will make us more money than Harvest picking up change?
It is not a bad thing, and it will not because anyone trouble.
That is where the business comes in!
Give Okuyasu and me half of what we make for the idea fee.
You will take the other half, Shigechi.
The three of us are going to work together to pull off a huge project,
and we can all become happy.
That is fine, but wh-what should I do?
You know what this is, right?
When you shop at one of Eastern Japan's biggest department store chains,
Kameyu, you get one sticker for every 100 yen you spend.
I think there are a lot of people who
do not collect these and just throw them away.
A voucher from a stationery shop, Meiwado, worth 20 yen.
A coupon from CD Shop Oscar,
where you can trade in ten for 2,000 yen worth of merchandise.
The cleaners, the toy shop Marchen Kids...
And this is a card from Yotsuba Electronics.
Now, this is the important part.
At Kameyu, for example, you can get cash back for these.
I know what you are thinking!
With only one or two, they would just be scraps of paper...
But if Harvest happened to pick up
the thousands and ten thousands that are thrown away around town...
Th-They just keep piling up one after another!
We will fix the ripped pieces of paper with Shining Diamond.
Do we have tens of thousands now?
No, it is definitely over 100,000 by now.
Let us go get our money!
But, Josuke, you sure are something.
After you went on about pride and junk...
Well, in this case, everyone is happy, so it is fine.
O-Okuyasu, J-Josuke, I wonder if it will be okay.
Will it turn into money that easily?
Were you able to get the money?
Did they tell you to piss off?
I was not able to get cash back at the CD shop or the toy store.
But I can exchange the coupons for about 40,000 yen worth of CDs or video games.
I am not asking about that!
Were you able to get cash back for the Kameyu stickers?
Actually, something kind of unexpected happened.
It is right in front of my eyes!
Your Stand, Harvest, is really amazing!
Y-You really think it is amazing?
Hey... P-People do not really compliment me much...
Do you really think I am amazing?
Hey, have a little more confidence, Shigechi.
This is something that only you can do.
Want To go have some fun?
So that is a token of our friendship.
This is not what we promised, is it?
You said okay to us getting half, and you getting the other.
It w-was my H-Harvest's job to collect all of those.
Y-You two were just talking and did nothing.
And, if Josuke had not come up with the idea,
you never would have thought of gathering up all those!
I would have eventually thought of it!
You never would have thought of it with that pea brain of yours!
Come here, fall back a sec.
Apparently he was fine with a few thousand,
but once it went over ten thousand, he is much more hesitant to pay up.
I do not think he means anything bad by it, but since he is got the mind of a kid,
no matter what we say, he is going to feel like we tricked him.
We should be the adults here and let it be.
We got 10,000 yen out of it, so let us call that good.
I guess if you are okay with it, I will not argue...
But this just pisses me off so much!
Are you sure he is not taking advantage of us?
No, Okuyasu, there is no point in fighting right now.
We just need to teach Shigechi how adults actually make agreements.
Oh, so you can make more money?
But that is what I love about you.
Is there anything you want to drink?
You are going to buy it for me?
Then... I want some Calpis Water.
Why are you throwing those away?
They are just worthless junk tickets, like for the year-end lottery.
I told Shigechi to pick them up along with everything else earlier.
You mean the losing New Year's Lottery tickets?
How do you know it is a losing ticket?
No one would throw away a winning ticket, dumbass.
There are lots of people who forget
to confirm the numbers and never get their prizes!
If this wins, I am going to take half of it.
But if you win a sheet of stamps, I do not want it.
You really like those cheap, annoying ways of gambling.
I wonder if we are allowed
to claim prizes from the lottery if we are in high school.
It should be fine as long as you have your ID and name stamp.
Nope, this one's not a winner.
I thought there might be a chance, but...
Hey, maybe, just maybe, if I won...
Do I have to take it to the police?
There is no reason to take it there.
Harvest just picked them up after people threw them away.
And you should only worry about that when you are bragging after you win.
Hey, what are you yelling for?
There is no doubt about it!
You better not be messing around, damn it!
It is a dream come true!
There is no other experience like this!
Let us confirm it one more time.
There is no doubt about it!
It is too good to be true, but it is true!
And it is a lottery ticket that was thrown away,
so it would have just gone into the incinerator.
There is still a few days before it expires.
Even if they ask us annoying questions when we go to cash it at the bank,
we can just proudly say that we bought it!
Which means it is our 5,000,000 yen!
I wonder what I should buy.
First, I got to get some kewl Italian shoes!
Then I will buy a high-end suit with a sexy silhouette,
and go all-out at Tonio's shop and eat the most expensive food!
I also want to go overseas somewhere!
I am going to put it in savings!
Man, talk about a boring life!
M-My Harvest is the one that picked that up...
Th-There is no way I am giving up half of it.
Episode 19 Shige chi's Ha rvest, Part 2
